definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: They probably arrived in the United States with settlers and traders from Europe.
sentences.chinese: 它們可能是與定居者和商人一起從歐洲來到美國的。

sentences.english: The settlers say terrorists hide among the trees.
sentences.chinese: 定居者說有恐怖分子藏在樹叢裏。

sentences.english: The first white settlers traveled across America in wagons.
sentences.chinese: 第一批白人定居者橫跨美洲大陸時乘的是四輪馬車。

sentences.english: The first known settlers of Britain were the Iberians.
sentences.chinese: 伊比利亞人是人們所知道的最早的英國的定居者。

sentences.english: One of the photographers threw stones at the settlers.
sentences.chinese: 錄像上，一名攝影記者向定居者投擲石塊。

sentences.english: Settlers from France reached Canada in 1534.
sentences.chinese: 1534年來自法國的定居者到了加拿大。

sentences.english: You're killing settlers and taking their gold.
sentences.chinese: 你真害死定居者和帶他們的金子。

sentences.english: Many of the settlers fell prey to these infections and died shortly after.
sentences.chinese: 許多定居者成了犧牲品，這些人感染疾病後不久死亡。

sentences.english: One of the settlers, *, berated police carrying out the evictions.
sentences.chinese: 其中一名定居者譴責警察的驅逐令。

sentences.english: The residents of deserts of Mongolia and China is endangered.
sentences.chinese: 這些在蒙古和中國沙漠上的定居者正面臨滅絕的危險。

sentences.english: There were no serious injuries and the settlers were allowed to walk away.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人在衝突中受重傷，定居者後來被放走了。

sentences.english: The Maori signed an agreement with the European settlers.
sentences.chinese: 毛利人和歐洲定居者簽署了一項協議。

sentences.english: Some of the settlers are reported to have barricaded themselves inside a building in the outpost.
sentences.chinese: 據悉一些定居者將自己封在邊哨站一座大樓內。

sentences.english: Japan then sold the islands in 1932 to descendants of the original settlers.
sentences.chinese: 之後1932年日本國將釣魚島出售給當地定居者。

definition: Romani, an ethnic group of Europe

pinyin: You2 tai4 fu4 guo2 zhu3 yi4

definition: the Copts, major ethnoreligious group of Egyptian Christians
Maori, indigenous Polynesian people of New Zealand
